author: elizabethadetula
title: WATCH: Elmo gets fired from Sesame Street and it’s all thanks to Donald Trump
text:
Elmo got the sack (Picture: Getty) Warning: this video may just shock you. 
In a clip that we’re not quite sure whether to laugh nervously about or grab some tissues and have a cry, the Sesame Street favourite gets sacked from his role on the street.
Miranda Hart missed This Morning interview because she was buying Phillip and Holly gifts We know what you’re thinking. Say it ain’t so, right?
Well if this clip is anything to go by, things don’t look too good.

The video posted by What’s Trending on Facebook, was simply captioned: ‘Due to cuts in funding to PBS, our favorite furry monster is out of work. #ParodyElmo.’
This clip is clearly a dig at Donald Trump’s recent proposed budget cuts to the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, which helps fund PBS and NPR; PBS is the channel the classic kids favourite airs on.
In the video, Elmo gets laid off by an unseen voice off camera and told: ‘Elmo…it does me no great joy to inform you that due to recent cuts in government funding to PBS, you are no longer employed by Sesame Street workshop.’
The furry red puppet replies: ‘Just like that? Elmo has been working at Sesame Street for 32 years!’
Just to warn you, the end gets very dark.
It’s no surprise that Trump might have a grump with the PBS staple show as they’ve parodied him for years in the form of a miserable puppet called Ronald Grump.

However, in more happier news, Sesame Street reminded us why we love the show after announcing that they would be welcoming a muppet who has autism called Julia. 
Julia will be the first autistic character on Sesame Street (Picture: Sesame Street/YouTube) MORE: Sesame Street’s autistic character isn’t the only time they’ve tackled tricky topics for children 
MORE: Sesame Street to welcome new muppet called Julia, who has autism
